text: I have been anticipating this remake for over 2 years now. But after watching this trailer, all hope is crushed. Out of all the "remakes", "reboots", and "re-imaginings" they have made (or should I say ruined?), the only ones that were actually worth watching are Rob Zombie's Halloween and The Texas Chainsaw Massacre (I also loved "I Spit On Your Grave"). Of course there are the others that have practically destroyed the originals like Friday the 13th, A Nightmare on Elm St, Carrie, Prom Night, Last House On The Left, The Hills Have Eyes, along with many more I can't think of right now. My point is that Hollywood NEEDS to stop ruining these great movies. If you're gonna remake such a beloved classic horror film, for fuck's sake, do it right!  Here are a handful of upcoming "remakes" that are either being filmed currently or in production: Stephen King's It (For the love of clowns, do this one right!), Rosemary's Baby, The Exorcist (The only question I have is What took them so long?), Flatliners, Leprechaun (A reboot couldn't hurt it more than "Leprechaun is Space" did), The Crow, Toxic Avenger, Gremlins (Don't touch it Hollywood, please don't!), Goonies, Highlander, Jumanji (without Robin Williams there is just no point), Cliffhanger, Dirty Dancing, The Neverending Story, Mortal Kombat (In today's world so much could be done with this movie, I think an R rating is mandatory here), Waterworld (LOL!), Overboard, Weird Science, War Games, The Mummy, The Goonies (is there anybody in the world good enough to replace Chunk? That's what I thought.), Mrs Doubtfire (read Jumanji), Short Circuit, Bloodsport, Time Cop, Police Academy, Flight of the Navigator (A smack in the face of childhood!), Tomb Raider (I doubt it could be worse than the 1st one), Scarface (What do you think Al?), National Lampoon's Vacation (Randy Quaid is irreplaceable as cousin Eddie!), Honey, I Shrunk The Kids (No Rick Morranis, No Movie, period!) I can't believe how many remakes they are planning on doing! I'm still waiting for that one remake that I can say was just as good, or better than the original. After dozens and dozens of movies that Hollywood has remade, there isn't one yet, so my hope is fading fast, but it could happen, it really could! Maybe Point Break will be it, due out in July.

text: I don't see why so many people hate this movie when it isn't even out yet. Yes, the trailer gives more away than it should in my opinion. Yes, it looks like it is mostly overdone jumpscares, and yes, it is pretty much the same thing as many others. However, I think the people should give it a chance. There have been trailers that make a movie look great, and ends up being horrible. There have been trailers...like this one...that make a movie look like it it will utterly suck, yet sometimes they are great. I wish most people wouldn't jump to conclusions on movies based off of a 2 minute preview of a 2 hour movie. There have been great Hollywood remakes, there have been "ehh" and there have been horrible Hollywood remakes. The way I see it, and yes this is my personal opinion hence no need to argue with my thoughts, trailers are not really something that should be used as judgment. Some producers make bad choices in choosing what to put in the trailer. The other 1 hour and 58 minutes might be amazing. Just throwing this out there. text: While this movie is either a reboot or remake of the first film, it does bear several similarities to Poltergeist II. Character of Carigan Burke is very obviously based on Taylor, while serving the purpose Tangina served in the first movie. In this movie, Eric has just been fired from his job and is unhappy with his current life, just like Steven lost his real estate license and became vacuum cleaner seller. In this movie, Eric drinks alcohol and spits it all out, just like Steven did in famous scene in Poltergeist II.
author: Miroslav Tomic

text: Some scenes from original are not recreated in this movie, but some other things are tributes to them. For example, when Kendra is tucking Madison in, they start counting how many times Kendra kisses Maddie's doll in unision. The way they do it is absolutely same as when Steven and Robbie count seconds between lightning and thunder and in both cases the final count is three. Not to mention that right after that Griffin comes in and says "Storm is coming closer", the same line Robbie said to his parents in original.

text: Being 25, i have seen quite a few horror films throughout my life. Growing up, IT and the Shining, scared the #$@! out of me, but it was partially because i didnt understand what was happening. Watching those films now, its just....silly...the blood balloon in IT..lmao As i have watched classic/modern  horror films evolve to keep up with new technology and the changes in audience "taste", it seems as if what used to be scary...just isnt anymore. Personally, i love found footage movies. They dont even have to be scary for me to enjoy them, but the "horror" found footage movies, to me, have a the edge on modern or classic scary films because of their "plausibility" due to the way they are filmed. Granted a random SLAM! or JUMP! can still be considered a scare, but for any horror film to rely on those alone, is ultimately not going to considered "scary".  Poltergeist did a pretty good job of keeping some original plot elements while not only keeping up with special effects and new tech, but actually implementing those very things into the plot, which earned points. The movie however, isnt scary....and its not because its a reboot or that we have seen it before.....you cant call a reboot "original"...it just doesnt hit the level of "scary" that i personally desired.  An example of a pretty good, non found footage scary film that is recent would be It Follows..... It may not have made me "jump" but i was genuinely scared of the plot, the idea of what the movie is .... idk, its complicated for me to articulate the proper way, but it just seems that horror movies dont do it anymore...call it desensitized or call it unoriginal... or maybe i am just a tough critic....but i am always looking for my next scare and unfortunately Poltergeist didnt deliver and just barely managed to keep my interest. Overall 5/10.
